1.name: North Oakland LessWrong
1.entry_instructions: Buzz for Kopczynski (or ask for the door code); we're  two floors up, at the back of the building. If this does not work, try ${phone}.

2.body: We'll play board games and socialize! We have a variety of games, but feel free to bring your own.

3.body: We'll play board games and socialize! We have [a variety of games](https://pastebin.com/Z1bbF9AV), but feel free to bring your own.

4.entry_instructions: For help getting into the building, please call (or text, with a likely-somewhat-slower response rate): ${phone}.

5.body:
We'll select interesting blog posts or articles at the meetup itself, then read them and discuss. Please come with articles you want to discuss! 

(Suggestions gathered in this Google doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1u-bg9m2br-0gA); feel free to add some even if you're not coming!)

6.body:

(Suggestions gathered in [this Google doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1u-bg9m2br-0gA); feel free to add some even if you're not coming!)

1.str: 540 Alcatraz Ave, Oakland, CA 94609, United States

2.str: 2740 Telegraph Ave, Berkeley, CA 94705, United States

1.title: ${name} Meetup: ${month} ${day_of_month}: ${topic_name}
1.boilerplate:
We meet every ${day_of_week} in ${city} at ${start_time}, with a rotating variety of topics but don’t generally start the meetup topic until ${start_time_plus_30m} to accommodate stragglers. Often there is a food delivery order that goes out before we start the meetup topic.

The ${name} meetup is intended as a fun, low-key social space with some structured interaction, where new and non-new community members can mingle and have interesting conversations.
Everyone is welcome, and RSVPs are never required.

We explicitly encourage people to split off from the main conversation or diverge from the topic if that would be more fun for them (moving side conversations into a separate part of the space if appropriate). Meetup topics are here as a tool to facilitate fun interaction, and we certainly don’t
want them to inhibit it.
